posts.name: Carlton D'Silva
posts.cooked:
Dear Student,

This post is with regards to your performance in Graded Assignment 0 (GA0), if you scored below 60% or did not attempt the GA0 itself. This assignment was designed to assess your comfort in:

  • Python programming
  • HTML and JavaScript
  • Excel proficiency
  • Basic data science concepts

Your current score indicates significant gaps in these prerequisite skills, which are crucial for success in this course. Based on previous experience, students who start with similar skill levels typically:

  • Struggle to keep up with course material
  • Achieve lower overall grades
  • May face delays in their graduation timeline due to poor performance in various assessments

Recommended Action:
I strongly advise you to:

  1. Pause and reassess your readiness for this course
  2. Strengthen your foundational skills in the areas mentioned above
  3. Consider taking this course in a future semester when better prepared

If you choose to continue despite this warning, please understand:

  • The course pace and difficulty will not be adjusted
  • Grade accommodations will not be made
  • Your final grade will reflect your actual performance

Your academic success is important to us, which is why we’re providing this candid feedback. Please make an informed decision about your course enrollment.

If you need guidance on resources to improve your skills, feel free to reach out.

Best regards,
TDS Course Team

posts.name: Ankit Sharma
posts.cooked:
Feedback :

Its a great idea to check course readiness before starting a course, should be available for other courses too.

But why after being enrolled in the course?

I hope it’d be available before one enrolls in the course in future terms.

posts.name: Anand S
posts.cooked: Blunt Translation: If you didn’t take GA0 or scored below 60%, you’ll spend more time on TDS AND get low grades. Please take TDS later, not now.

posts.name: Anant Luthra
posts.cooked:
Whereas if i consider my case…
When i started watching videos of this course before the term was started…
i was like wow… this course is teaching what i wanted to explore on my own…
And now i’ve got this as my diploma course in this BS degree itself…

Thanks for Creating such course…
I’m really pursuing a NEP updated curriculum.

posts.name: Ankit Sharma
posts.cooked:
one can drop the course after viewing the question.
Giving access before taking this course would be difficult for the team. What can we do watch orientation carefully
Listen to our peers

posts.name: Rama Kant Sharma
posts.cooked:
Hi,
I am really sorry that I missed GA0 assignment.
I was in impression that GA0 is just for practice.
I agree that it was my misunderstanding.
Anyway, I will be more regular now onwards.
Apologies for the same.

posts.name: Ankit Sharma
posts.cooked:
1. Difficulty for the team - Why would it be difficult? Is it so difficult to put out an assessment for all students that you’d rather make the students enroll into the course and then let them drop based on their marks in one assignment?
  2. Watch orientation carefully and peer review - Might help a little bit, but often perceived difficulty of a course by oneself or the peers and actual difficulty level differs. This holds specially since we have people from diverse backgrounds.
